lead_paragraph: Dima al-Wawi, a 12-year-old jailed for two months for planning to stab an Israeli soldier, was one of hundreds of Palestinian children jailed since attacks on Israelis surged.

byline.contributor: Rami Nazzal contributed reporting from the West Bank, and Myra Noveck from Jerusalem.

headline.print_headline: As Attacks Surge, Boys and Girls Fill Israeli Jails
headline.main: Surge in Palestinian Youths in Prison Tests Israel’s Justice System

snippet: Dima al-Wawi, a 12-year-old jailed for two months for planning to stab an Israeli soldier, was one of hundreds of Palestinian children jailed since attacks on Israelis surged.
abstract: Israel releases 12-year-old Palestinian Dima al-Wawi from prison after serving two and half months behind bars for bringing knife to Israeli settlement in occupied West Bank; Wawi's case renews debate over how Israel’s military justice system, which prosecutes Palestinians from West Bank, differs from courts that cover Israeli citizens and Palestinian residents of Jerusalem, and especially how it handles minors.
